title.narrative: 002. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) PRACTICES PROMOTION

description.narrative: Targeted rural communities in the Dry Zone, conflict affected children and women in Mon and Kayin States practice key hygienic behaviours (consistent use of toilet - stop open defecation practice), hand-washing with soap at critical times, and drinking safe water), which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Water and excreta related diseases in under-5 children are equitably reduced.

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Targeted rural communities in the Dry Zone, conflict affected children and women in Mon and Kayin States practice key hygienicbehaviours (consistent use of toilet - stop open defecation practice), hand-washing with soap at critical times, and drinking safewater)

description.narrative: 204 villages with 87,326 people (51 percent women) in 3 states/regions were verified and declared as ODF villages. From 2014 to 2017, altogether 588 villages in 5 States and Region have declared ODF. 324 new villages from 4 States/Region have initiated the process but will be verified in 2018. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/12/2017
